results.title: The Nature of healing
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description: This 6 part series draws upon the combined knowledge of Eastern and Western medicine, and reveals techniques and therapies to achieve true health and harmony. It will change the way life and health is perceived.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images

results.title: They came to Cordura
results.creator_credit: Robert Rossen, William Goetz and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Set during a Mexican expedition in 1916, Gary Cooper is cast as a self doubting Army Major, who believing himself to be a coward, relieves himself of his combat duties and is assigned the inglorious task of locating five battle heroes and ensuring their safe passage to the Cordura military base. The five heroes are worthy of a medal of honour, something that appeals to the “cowardly” Army Major. The mission is going along smoothly until the arrival of an American woman accused of treason (Rita Hayworth), as the film evolves into an intense study of character and endurance. Cast also includes Van Heflin and Tab Hunter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Rossen, William Goetz and Columbia Pictures

results.title: Biomagnetism
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
This program looks at magnetic field therapy, an approach much researched, particularly in Japan. Biomagnetic therapy combined with drug therapy has been used to successfully treat depression, dementia, non-healing fractures and spinal injuries.

results.title: Brownie Movie Camera model 2
results.brief_description:
Kodak Brownie f/1.9 Improved Model II 8mm Movie Camera with case

STANDARD LENSES: Cine-Kodak Ektanon 13mm f/1.9
SPEED: 16 frames / second
VIEWFINDER:folding Sports Viewfinder
FILM: 8 mm

Kodak Dealer Catalogue 1960 Kodak (Australasia) PTY.Ltd:
A new and improved model of the popular 8mm. Brownie Movie Camera. This inexpensive movie camera provides all the fun of making sparkling 8mm. full-colour home movies with the simplicity of taking black- and white snapshots. All the user has to do is load, set the lens aperture pointer (according to the lighting conditions bright, dull, etc.), and press the button. A fast Lumenized 13mm. Cine Ektanon f/1.9 lens ensures bright sharp pictures. Sprocketless loading makes film threading easy and straightforward film is simply slipped into the gate and onto the take-up reel. Other features are: Long-running spring-driven motor; two-position exposure release; collapsible plastic viewfinder with parallax correction; easily read footage indicator; fingertip click stop aperture control; and handy tripod thread. Of aluminium con­struction, it is complete with a solid hide, velvet lined compartment case. Loads with doublerun Kodachrome Movie Film.

results.title: Homeopathy
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Homoeopathy is a complementary medicine which is gradually gaining acceptance within traditional medicine. It is a therapy with a holistic approach, treating the causes rather than the symptoms of illness.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images

results.title: These things I still question
results.creator_credit: Ken Saunders, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ken Saunders questions the things in his life that he didn’t understand, like why his dad was treated differently, why he couldn’t play with the white kids and why people just let this happen.

results.title: Touch
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
Massage and touch therapies are commonly used to alleviate stress with steam baths together with massage a common therapy used in Japan and Hawaii. Aromatherapy, meditation, acupressure and reflexology are often combined to give holistic treatment to stress sufferers.

results.title: Country is my life
results.creator_credit: John Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Johnnie Lovett endeavours to express his love for country music, how it feeds his spirit and the people who have inspired and encouraged him to become a musician in the first place.

results.title: Acupuncture
results.creator_credit: Celia Tait, Brian Beaton, SBS-TV and Reel Images
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Nature of healing”.
The emphasis of acupuncture is on prevention rather than cure. First documented in ancient Chinese texts, acupuncture can be combined with other therapies to alleviate pain and is often used instead of anaesthesia. Cupping and acupressure use acupuncture techniques without the insertion of needles.

results.title: EEE Motor Zoom 8
results.brief_description:
Canon EEE Motor Zoom 8 with leather Canon carry case, booklets, film, lens cleaning tissue and accessories.

From Canon museum website: “The performance of batteries improved significantly around 1959, and batteries with stable performance became available in the market. At the same time, Canon was developing a micro-motor. This is how development of a movie camera with better operability, the core feature of these cameras, started. Instead of a conventional spring motor, it applied an electric motor that could drive film continuously much longer than a spring motor, fully using battery capability. Zooming was performed electrically, as was exposure control, which was called EE, or Electric Eye (AE, or Automatic Exposure today). These were major factors for a very compact movie camera design. Because of its three electric functions, it was named the “EEE”.

The lens was a newly developed 4x f/1.7 zoom lens. Aperture control with two outside levers made EE, manual exposure and fading operation easy. A film rewind crank was applied at the same time. As a result, this camera became suitable for both beginners and advanced amateurs”
